column2: The unending ranks of the dead trample over all in their path, seeking only the death of those still living.
With large chunks of the population wiped out, the dead here would provide easy troops for the undead
With large chunks of the population wiped out, the dead here would provide easy troops for the undead
With large chunks of the population wiped out, the dead here would provide easy troops for the undead
The dead in this province have begun to overwhelm the living
Attacks from [Root.GetRevenantTerm] have ravaged this province.  Recovery will be difficult.
Raise the corpses you have gathered as troops for your horde
Wipe out a portion of your living population to supply yourself with more corpses
Ressurrect some of your corpses to use for labor
Force the living to rework some of the local buildings to better serve the horde.
Scrouge through the available corpses searching for treasures and valuables
Resurrect corpses until a good commander is found
Resurrect corpses until a good priest is found
Resurrect corpses until a good steward is found
Resurrect corpses until a good diplomat is found
Resurrect corpses until a good spy is found
The dead have risen up and begun to swarm upon the living
Those who are dead have instead risen again and gone forth to destroy the living.
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ [Root.GetRevenantTermCap] Invasion to Feed on the Living
Charge into a nearby realm so that the dead may feast on the flesh of the living
All affected provinces lose prosperity and may convert to undead cultures or religion
All affected provinces gain devastation and may convert to undead cultures or religion
Gain corpses from each province based on prosperity, depopulation, and devastation
Attempt to force the provinces of an opposing undead to fit your kind of undeath
Seize control over the land that you have ravaged

Members seek complete independence. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!. The leader of the Independence faction is likelier to take greater risks than other faction leaders, and will have fewer qualms about striking when the liege is already under attack.

Present an ultimatum to §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, demanding independence for you and the other members of the Independence Faction. If [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuses to comply, the Faction will rise in revolt.
column3: Présentez un ultimatum [Root.Liege.Get_au_Title]§Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§! pour exiger votre indépendance ainsi que celle des membres de la faction d'indépendance. [Root.Liege.GetSilSielleCap] refuse votre requête, votre faction prendra alors les armes.
column4: Stellt §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§! ein Ultimatum und fordert Unabhängigkeit. Wenn [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] dies ablehnt, wird Eure Fraktion in einen Aufstand geraten.
column6: Enviar un ultimátum a §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, reclamando la independencia para ti y los demás miembros de la Facción Independencia. Si [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] se niega a concederla, tu Facción se sublevará.

column2: Spare bodies are piled up against the walls, absorbing attacks and ruining the footing of invaders
A building storing human remains that were unsuitable for burial or had to be removed to make room for more graves.
A large graveyard is within the local walls for interring the dead in graves and tombs.
The city has underground passageways where the bodies of the deceased can be entombed or immured.
Many homes in the area have been abandoned as the inhabitants have fled, died, or been turned
Bodies of drowned sailors have begun to wash up on the shores at the coast
With the city under the grip of the undead, formerly sunken ship have begun to appear in the harbor
As the undead have taken over the city, many in the city's university have been killed, then reanimated to defend the city
With the undead in control of the city, the few humans remaining have turned to the worship of demons or dark gods, or are those devoted the practice of necromancy
A [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] grave plot, holding the bodies of the deceased on what was once consecrated ground.
Chambers below the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] house the bodies of local holy men and nobles, though the local corruption leaves them ready to rise again.
As the inhabitants have fled the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship], the old ships in the shipyard have been left abandoned, yet still ready for use
Most of the willing inhabitants left in the church are cultists and necromancers.  What was once a place of learning is now a home for the dark arts.
With the nobles of this castle gone, its defences and armory lie free for use.
Many criminals and heretics have met the execution's axe in this place, and now their restless souls aid the undead
Chambers below the caslte house the bodies of ancient lords, though the local corruption leaves them ready to rise again.
A large butcher for royal hunts houses the remains of animals well suited for the undead army
Many homes in the area have been destroyed and those who live there are left exposed to the undead horde
There are a number of wrecked ships on the shored near the castle.  While unsuited for humans, they work well enough for those already dead.
A large mound of earth and stone raised over the ancient graves of kings and chiefs
An ancient earthen chamber-tomb with an entrance lined by decorated stones, holding the corpses of rulers of old
An ancient tomb formed from giant stone slabs
This village is built around a local crossroads, exposing travellers to attacks from the undead
An old grave designed to resemble a ship to ferry its passenger to the next world, now used to ferry the undead in this one
The site of an old battle, full of forgotten bodies and ancient tombs
An ancient field of small graves, holding the corpses of many old warriors
A tomb where the horse is buried with its rider, now with both raised to server in the undead horde
A butchery, turned to kill the tribes horses, then bring them back as fearless undead steed
Burial customs often have a warrior's weapons and armor buried with them. These items are readily available for the undead
A group grave for paupers, foreigners, and the excommunicated, unable to receive a proper burial
A special vault of human remains created by a necromancer for ease of raising the dead.
Risen corpses wander throughout this area.
As you succumb to the hunger and lose your last ounce of humanity, you know that just as you led in life, so too shall you lead in death.
As the curse drains your mind, so too does it drain your faith. You find that you no longer believe in anything but whatever force brought you back from the grave.
The gods have no power here.

For some time now my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has been overcome with bodily pains. I have now been informed that the symptoms are due to a plague that controls the body after death.
Your body is full of strange aches and pains as if your body was dying with every breath yet would continue on without you.  You have contracted the plague of the living death.
As your heart beats its last, your pain begins to subside.  Thought fades from your mind, and what remains naught but a hunger.

As the plague spreads through my lands, I have received disturbing reports that the dead in [Root.GetName] have begun to rise and torment the living.  Life in the area is now a daily struggle against the undead.
What madness has taken this land?
The dead have risen up in the provice of [Root.GetName], laying waste to the towns and killing any living being they come across.
I shall return them to the dust.
The dead have risen up in the provice of [Root.GetName], laying waste to the towns and killing any living being they come across.
I shall return them to the dust.
More [From.GetRevenantTermPlural] have begun to rise in [From.GetName], creating further devastation and reinforcing the existing undead.
How many more will there be?
More [From.GetRevenantTermPlural] have begun to rise in [From.GetName], creating further devastation and reinforcing the existing undead.
How many more will there be?
One of the buildings in [Root.GetName] has been converted to suit the undead.
One of the buildings in [Root.GetName] has been repaired and can once again be used by the living.
As the living have once again returned to [Root.GetName], so too has [Root.Culture.GetName] culture begun to spread.
As the living have once again returned to [Root.GetName], so too has the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith begun to spread.
As the living get wiped from the province, all that remains in [Root.GetName] is the cult of the damned.
As you wander, you feel a strange pull on your mind.  You can't help but feel the need to do the bidding of [FromFrom.GetBestName].
As I expected, my magic has taken control over the [Root.GetRevenantTerm], [From.GetBestName], forcing [From.GetHerHim] to bend to my will.

Recently, I feel like my mind has been influenced by some outside force, trying to force me to bend to its will.  I've been strong enough to avoid the full brunt of its compulsions, yet I still feel my mind bending in their favor.
While [From.GetBestName] still has some control over [From.GetHerHis] mind, I have managed to sway [From.GetHerHis] will in my favor.
I tried to use my magic to bring [From.GetBestName] under my control, but [From.GetHerHis] will is too strong.  I've only manage to tire myself out.
Your entire body is stiff and sore, while you mind swims in a painful stupor. Even bits of flesh have begun to rot on your still-living body.  You have contracted the plague of undeath.
The roaming dead have become an increasing problem in [Root.GetName].  Soon, they may well overrun the living.
As a [Root.GetRevenantTerm], the faithful view me as a monster and ill-suited to lead the faith.  I have been driven from the land and forced to abdicate my position
Soon, undeath will come for them too.
